title: Timeline of the 106-Hour OpenAI Saga, Altman Will Return, New Board Formed
relevance_explanation: The document provides in-depth coverage of the events surrounding Sam Altman's firing and subsequent actions, making it highly relevant for understanding the decisions and motivations of the involved parties, as well as the shifts in power dynamics within OpenAI.
summary: The document details the complex series of events that transpired after Sam Altman's firing from OpenAI, including internal dissent, public reaction, negotiations over his return, involvement of Microsoft's CEO Satya Nadella, and Altman ultimately joining Microsoft. It charts the negotiations breakdown, the power struggle within the OpenAI board, the role of interim CEO Emmett Shear in Altmanâ€™s return, and the employee backlash. Major investment and innovation implications alongside various responses from key stakeholders in the industry are also discussed.
events: Sam Altman appears set to return to OpenAI but negotiations break down
Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announces Altman and Brockman will join Microsoft
Overwhelming employee demand for board resignation
OpenAI CTO Mira Murati informed of Altman's pending dismissal
Altman and Brockman share updates on social media about being fired and quitting
Employees question Ilya Sutskever about a potential palace coup
Senior AI research scientists announce resignation
Rumors arise concerning the impact of management shake-up on potential funding
Tiger Global and Sequoia pressure board to reverse the decision
Sam Altman begins negotiations to return as CEO
OpenAI COO reassures staff there was no malfeasance
Speculation about OpenAI's technical breakthrough and its impact on board decisions
Sam Altman's return as CEO is announced with a new oversight board formed
